website_summaries.verdict: A simple choice that many will find reliable. Stability of the individual must be considered – 2 wheels might not be enough.
pros: Height adjusts easily and the unit is sturdy
cons: Wheels do not adjust to the inside for extra clearance

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE. This product can't be returned, even if defective.
customer_reviews.text: This product, if defective, can't be returned. You're stuck with it like I am. I admit, I didn't know amazon.com sold products that are defective and can't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: fundayprosperity

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t want to put my loved one on this Walker . Very flimsy and cheaply put together.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for this product and thought it would be a good fit for what I was looking for for my loved one . The product came quickly like stated it would but when I opened up the box I was very disappointed with how flimsy and cheap it was put together . There’s no way in heck I’m gonna let my love no one use this as their main means of support to move around . I attempted to return it come to find out the company does not take returns which was another surprise that I was not aware of so I would say stay away from this product altogether .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one month of use.
customer_reviews.text: I broke my leg about a month ago. The bought this walker because of the reviews/popularity. I had it for a little over a month, when one of the legs just snapped and broke where the joint is. The whole time the walker was very wobbly and felt fragile. I thought i will not need another one, until i recover. I only used it indoors, around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Nikole Ivanov

customer_reviews.title: After only two weeks of use this walker broke
customer_reviews.text: The folding device pin that keeps the walker in the open position broke so now the folding arm won't stay in the open position so it can't be used. I guess I'll put a bolt in it's place so it can be used but that eliminates the folding mechanism. What a pain
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with two right front wheels and I am unable to modify the wrong one. Consequently, the wheel are unbalanced to one side. I am having surgery immediately and am unable to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Dupont

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use after a hip surgery. I did not put it together until right before the surgery. Once it was together I realized that all of the legs were not the same length so it is very unstable. One of the legs is shorter than the other four. Unfortunately I realized this after the return window has closed.
customer_reviews.author: HOLLIE LITTLE

customer_reviews.title: broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why but this walker was not good. I am trying to use the warranty to replace it, I had I prior walker from Drive that lasted over 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: for arthritic fingers like mine, are difficult to "PUSH"
customer_reviews.text: I kept this only because I needed it right away but it is not what I wanted nor what is advertised as. It purported to be a "Deluxe Two Button Walker" but the buttons are these tinny sliders that, for arthritic fingers like mine, are difficult to "PUSH". I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Guy D'Urso

customer_reviews.title: Great Walker
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this walker. It is very lightweight and easy to fold so that I could put it in my van right behind the drivers seat. I broke my ankle about 4 weeks ago, and it saved me from killing myself using crouches. I am 67 and was not doing well on the crutches, so this was my life saver. I did have to tape some foam pieces on the handles since they are not as soft as I needed them to be. I used the foam that you wrap outdoor pipes for winterizing, and it works real nice.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: Just today opened the box to put together. NO wheels or additional rods to adjust length. Just this 3 foot high walker. PLEASE can someone tell me how to get refund on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Speerly

customer_reviews.title: This item is NOT eligible to return!
customer_reviews.text: My mother in law came for a visit, we thought she might be in need of a walker. She did not need the walker, the box has not been opened. I tried to return it but all I get is " this item is NOT eligible for return" see our return policy?
customer_reviews.author: allgood

customer_reviews.title: the product cannot be returned! It is a bad news if you do not like it.
customer_reviews.text: The description of the product is misleading: it hides an important fact that the product cannot be returned. You find out about this only after you already bought the product. So, I just wasted $30. Do not buy the product unless you are ready for this risk.
customer_reviews.author: AGK

customer_reviews.title: But this walker like any walker takes time to getting used too
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I bought this Deluxe Two Button Folding Walker by Drive Medical, some walkers are hard to open and close,maybe because there old? But this walker like any walker takes time to getting used too, and the height adjuster is great for short to tall people. The two buttons are like pushing the walker, once you try it out a few times ,you get it and feel comfortable with it,! I have bought a few products from Drive Medical and they are very good quality ! Thanks K.Red
customer_reviews.author: Reddin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously much cheaper than all of the local places I looked, and it is the exact product. Lightweight and portable, folds easily, and a lot of people ask this but you can actually move the wheels to the opposite side and make it slimmer so it fits through doorways easier. I recently had hip replacement and bought this as a second walker for indoors since the one they gave me at the hospital was getting worn out walking around outdoors. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Henry Haggard

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I did take the advice of previous purchasers ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 87 year old mother. Works great. I did take the advice of previous purchasers and installed the wheels on the INSIDE of the frame rather than on the outside (as is shown in the photo). By installing the wheels on the inside of the frame, my mother can more easily go thru small door openings, etc. Less chance of the wheels getting caught on an object as well. I also cut two tennis balls and inserted one on each of the rear posts. The tennis balls allow the walker to glide more smoothly across the floor. My mother simply pushes the walker along rather than having to pick it up with each step.
customer_reviews.author: K. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Poor or No Quality Control.
customer_reviews.text: Came missing 1 straight Leg and 1 wheeled Leg. but the Amazon customer service got me another one in 2 days. walker worked very well and i still use it a little. Great product, just wish it was a little wider to accommodate fat folks like me.
customer_reviews.author: Drew M.

customer_reviews.title: For thin short people.  Does not have brand logo.
customer_reviews.text: This is for a child or small person. It is narrow and can only accommodate someone shorter than about 5'6". It does not have the Drive logo. Arrived in a clear trash bag inside an Amazon box.
customer_reviews.author: Momoftwo

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this walker! I purchased this walker for my husband after he developed back problems and had trouble walking. He is so pleased with this walker, he can now get around the house safely. I also noticed that this is a popular walker at the physical therapy clinic! I would recommend buying tennis balls for the walker legs when using in the house it makes it much easier to glide on carpet and tile. I have not folded the walker yet we have an SUV so I don't need to fold the walker for transporting but it appears to be easy to fold.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Joint where folding push button cracked within 6 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: Got this on April 17th and it is now May 28th and it already cracking where one of the buttons are to fold it making it very unstable and downright dangerous. Of it is just past the deadline where you can return it. Buyer beware. Hope no one gets injured using this trash. Always inspect before using.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Crow

customer_reviews.title: It stinks...
customer_reviews.text: literally, it stinks. And I am not the type who is sensitive to odors but I think I got a lemon. If it only smelled like a lemon. It was the rubber hand grips. Stunk up my bedroom until I discovered the source. I think the rubber was not fully cured. The grips were really sticky and very smelly. I washed them twice, wiped down twice with iso alcohol, drenched them twice with Febreze, and left the walker outside in the sun for a couple days. I think the Febreze did the most good. This does not appear to be a common problem with this otherwise excellent walker.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use for an elderly person
customer_reviews.text: This looked great when i ordered it. My Mom can't push the buttons herself to release to fold it up. They are hard to push and she can't hang on and push them. It is a little big more narrow than her previous on. Sturdy and solid but she isn't thrilled. I don't recommend this. Folding it up for her is stiff and awkward for me as well.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Mom

customer_reviews.title: Strenght
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality I would be very careful using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Guidry III

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for extra large people
customer_reviews.text: I had to ask for a refund. My dad’s knees hit the side of it, even though it says it is good for up to 350 pounds. My dad is 280, and his knees hit the side.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for a walker.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my eldery mother. And Upon receiving it I found it was nothing like others had stated in their reviews. It came mostly assembled already, all parts were correct and in the box. It was super simple to put the rest together and if needed the wheels can be swapped for the inside if space is an issue. It feels very sturdy and not at all flimsy and very easy to push.
customer_reviews.author: Von Schweetz

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable, but functional
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this walker for a hip replacement recovery. Overall it is fine. The main issue are the hand grips. The are the most uncomfortable grips I have ever held on to. First, the are to small and made for someone that would wear a small or maybe a medium glove size. I wear a men's large /xl glove so there is no good way to hold onto the wallet. Second the grips are very firm and not cushioned in anyway also making the wallet difficult to hold on to. I would return it if I still had the box.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Beecher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is my first walker and it was perfect. I put it together myself although there was not much to put together it comes folded..lol .I am 82 and at the moment very sick and have lost my sense of balance and still It was easy .I like it without the wheels for now. On my first try I was able to walk out in front of my house and bring in my garbage pail on my first test drive......lol something i have not been able to do for months.I',m getting another one. The price is unbeatable so I'm adding a basket too!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Good walker, but buy the skies.
customer_reviews.text: This walker works well and folds easily. The legs were easy to adjust. The only problem was that the non wheel feet wore down to the medal in less than three weeks, and that was just from walks up and down the sidewalk after a knee replacement, not exactly a lot of walking. The skies that can be purchased are much better then the original feet. So buy the skies with the walker and you have a great walker.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Miller

customer_reviews.title: BROKE IN 1 WEEK
customer_reviews.text: It is not the most stable, but it is not too expensive. BUT WHEN A RIVET POPS OUT ON A STAIRWAY AND ALMOST MAKES ME FALL DOWN THE STAIRS , then there is a safety issue. I would not buy it again....and I NEVER leave bad reviews!!
customer_reviews.author: Patsfan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy, easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Lightweight, not overly bulky. Easy for my husband to maneuver. Fits well through doors, etc. Very easy to assemble, height adjusts easily. Wide range of height selection available. (Husband 6"1", not even on very top height available!)
customer_reviews.author: Marbee

customer_reviews.title: A WEAR PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: REAR LEG "CAPS"?? DO NOT WEAR WELL AND NO INFO ON REPLACEMENTS. SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE! LASTING ONE MONTH AT BEST DOES NOT CUT IT. THE LEGS WILL FOLD AND COLLAPSE WITHOUT THE LEG CAPS THAT DRAG. THEY MAY LAST FOREVER ON CARPET, BUT I USE MY WALKER TO GET ME TO AND FROM THE CAR--ON CONCRETE. THIS IS WERE I SEE SO MANY PEOPLE WITH "TENNIS BALLS" ON THE LEGS. IF THEY WILL NOT HOLD UP. THERE SHOULD BE INFO--AND REPLACEMENTS AVAILABLE. I FEEL THAT I NOW HAVE AN UNSAFE UNIT. SO I NEED TO BUY ONE EVERY MONTH??
customer_reviews.author: mike d

customer_reviews.title: Walkers come in sizes.......
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't thought about walkers coming in different widths. When you need to purchase one make sure to read or ask about the width of the unit you are considering. This walker is 19 inches wide (outside measurement) and was perfect for getting around in my house. A friend had loaned my a walker that was 24 inches wide that was too big to get around easily. This unit is very sturdy, stable and lightweight. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marz

customer_reviews.title: Poor attention to detail.
customer_reviews.text: Came with two of the same side wheels. Result: one wheel is on the outside of the leg as shown in the picture, the other is on the inside of the leg. That seems to be poor attention to detail in preparation for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Powers

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I got this walker to help me get around following a knee replacement. It worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BFF

customer_reviews.title: light weight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The walker is light weight and simple to fold. It is sturdy and the user can maneuver as necessary on all types of surfaces. It's light enough and collapsible to easily fit in the back seat of a vehicle. The height adjustment is simple and easy to use. The walker I purchased was originally used by someone over 6'2" and later used by someone about 5'9". Both users were happy with it's sturdiness and strength while rehabilitating back to full strength.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Big issue
customer_reviews.text: The product cannot be returned and it does not say that anywhere that I ca see on the product page. It has not been opened and is in original box. This is not reasonable and makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick J. Costello

customer_reviews.title: Deluxe Two Button Folding Walker
customer_reviews.text: It's hard as you get older to know what things will make life easier. I've got most of the aches and pains older people are heir to, but when I started using this walker, my aches and pains seemed to disappear! Not hyperbole, they literally seemed to disappear. It's a good product and I'm happy I finally took the plunge. And it was easy to put together!
customer_reviews.author: Brenjoy

customer_reviews.title: I believe my walker has 2 of the same wheels ...
customer_reviews.text: I believe my walker has 2 of the same wheels. When you try to put them on the inside of the walker one wheel will not click into place. I wish I could get this fixed cause my 92 year old mother uses it. Can You help?
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: easy to fold, better priced, and doctor's approved
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this walker for my husband that was having difficulty walking, and I did not want to spend a lot of money because I did not know if he needed it for the long haul. It turned out to be a fractured hip and he had to have a total hip replacement. The surgeon and the physical therapist saw the walker and they both said it was perfect. It is very easy to fold, very lightweight, and it had the best price of all. Before purchasing check with your doctor what type is the one that you need. The one with wheels, brakes and all the added whistles would have been worthless in our case.
customer_reviews.author: L. O. Branch

customer_reviews.title: Ideal walker. In use everywhere
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal walker for nearly any situation. Hospitals and Physical Therapy offices have them everywhere. Put your name on it as they are like rabbits if you are with others using a walker. The ideal choice, at $29 it is almost same price as buying it from a vendor with a Medicare script. Wife had a knee replacement and had one on each floor at home. The Medicare covered one was $100 -80% or $20 my cost. Provided at hospital by an equipment vendor. They get $80 to bring it to your room, remove from box, and adjust feet to patient height. $80 medicare coverage for 5 minutes work.
customer_reviews.author: TaxMan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It replaced an old walker that my mother had used 20 years ago. The reviews were mixed on this particular walker but I took a chance and I'm glad I did. It's easier to use than that old one and even lighter weight than the newer one I had gotten when I was in the hospital 2 years ago. I live in a 2 story house and need a walker on each floor. When this one arrived, I chose it for my downstairs walker that is used the most. The width is perfect for my doorways and even though it's lightweight, it is balanced very well and gives me a feeling a stability when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: eburchelli

customer_reviews.title: Strong plastic smell that doesn’t go away!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good price and will get me through hip replacement recovery but disappointed in the extremely strong plastic smell that is not going away. Not sure how such a small amount of plastic can smell so strong. Otherwise this walker is good enough for a short period of time. 9/27/20 Downgraded my rating from 3 stars to 1 star due to strong plastic smell that is as strong as it was when I received it on 9/06/20. The smell gives me a headache. I once bought a pair of pool shoes at a discount store that never lost this same terrible smell.
customer_reviews.author: Plains Woman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Walker
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed after throwing my back out. Had back surgery 2 years ago and should’ve invested in one then. This happens often so it was time to finally get one. It’s very stable and sturdy and was easy to assemble. And the best part was the price. I’m so happy with my purchase and got it delivered so quickly. I don’t know what I would do without amazon prime!
customer_reviews.author: pinkmnm305

customer_reviews.title: High quality walker
customer_reviews.text: I've learned that one doesn't need to spend a ton of money to get a perfectly adequate walker. Were I permanently disabled, I'd probably purchase a walker with hand brakes and perhaps one with a seat. For the brief period of time I'll use this walker after knee surgery, though, I have been very pleasantly surprised at the high quality of the design and construction. It didn't cost much, but it's nevertheless sturdier and more reassuring than the one I was trained on at physical therapy prior to surgery. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: milleron

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my grandpa. It arrived in great condition, very nice, easy to use and steer. He loved it for the first two weeks, but then the wheels got wobbly and started to pull him to the right. Which is a safety concern since he is unsteady already. He used his old walker outside so he wouldn't mess up the wheels on the new one, but they still gave out even with just inside use. The walker wasn't very expensive so I didn't expect it to last forever. I just wish it would have lasted longer than two weeks. Overall, it was a nice looking walker and works ok for the price, but definitely not a long term solution.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Came with no rear gliders...
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't come with any rear gliders, which is a problem since it scrapes the floors and leaves marks in carpets and catches throw rugs and floor mats and could cause a fall. Wait. Doesn't that really defeat the purpose of the walker? Plus, I think it is pretty flimsy and wonder how safe I really am with it. I liked my old rollator better because it had a set that I could sit on when needed, and it was much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: When my back went out last summer, and I could not move...I decided then to get a walker for support to and from the bathroom, and kitchen. If you know anyone that is looking for an adjustable, strong walker to get around in the house, this is the one. I was going to get a prescription for one from my doctor, and it just all seemed like too much of a hassle. So that is when I looked on Amazon, and thought why didn't think of this before now?? You can slide the pieces together without a problem, and it folds easily so it does not take up any space....This is perfect for my needs. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: lam

customer_reviews.title: Nice Walker
customer_reviews.text: My dad is real pleased with this walker. It has nice height adjustments and handles well for my dad. Make sure to get the right fit when choosing a walker though. My dad is medium frame and 6 feet tall. This walker is not very wide in the middle if one is a larger size person. Edit: My dad has now passed, but I still recommend this walker for those who may be interested in purchasing it. He did enjoy it when it was used.
customer_reviews.author: awesomep

customer_reviews.title: OK...BUT...
customer_reviews.text: OK...BUT...did not last. Not sure how long a walker should last but one side of the top push button mechanism broke after 2 months and that makes it very awkward to put into the car. I have been so busy with my Mother that had a stroke that I did not have a chance to return it or contact customer service so I can't say if the company would have made good on it or not. If not for the broken mechanism I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Lover

customer_reviews.title: It is VERY lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Mom's arthritis does not allow her to carry anything slightly heavy. So she used this after a fall. She is not using it at the moment, but we loved it so much, we are putting it away for future use. And if asked, we definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nowwhat

customer_reviews.title: Get walker, basket and tennis balls together
customer_reviews.text: I needed a walker and a way to carry stuff and to make the walker non-skid on my ceramic tile floor. One of the options with this walker included the purchase of Top Glides Precut Walker Tennis Ball Glides (Gray) and Drive Medical Walker Basket, White, with plastic cup holder... Good choice... it is working well for me and the height is adjustable so I feel very secure moving around the house until I can graduate to walking with a cane and ambulating like I used to do!
customer_reviews.author: TexasPepper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and GREAT VALUE! This walker arrived Early! AND so cheap! when I was told that I was having hip replacement surgery in 6 days, I had to have a walker. I went to the local drugstore that charged over half the price, over $75 bucks, and went on AMAZON, and it was here the next day! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I had a total knee replacement and had to use this until I was steady enough for a cane. It worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Vergie J

customer_reviews.title: So good, that I bought the second one!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned before buying because of some negative reviews, especially the one regarding safety. But decided to take a risk thinking that every product has a lemon from time to time. And I’m so glad I did it. It proved to be very sturdy very easy to operate, in and out of the house. It is easy to put in the car. Easy to fold and unfold. I like it so much that I just purchased the second one to have it always in my car.
customer_reviews.author: loska

customer_reviews.title: Not a fashion accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Had knee replacement surgery needed this to get around, everything works as it should. The only problem I have is the hand grips. I don't have large hands, but the bottom of the grip cuts into my hand to wear I have a blister on them. I looked at different grips for it however oversized pool noodles were expensive and hand wouldn't fit around them. So I wrapped batten(quilt fluff) around and covered with some snazzy duct tape. No more blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Does the job very nicely
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker for a disabled person who could no longer use the Drive rolling walkers. They moved too fast, and he couldn't walk fast enough to keep up with them. This walker works perfectly! It's slow enough that he can keep up and also control it. We bought the ready-to-use tennis ball attachments and now it's ideal.
customer_reviews.author: S Trent

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts and works as described
customer_reviews.text: I needed a walker for my upcoming knee surgery and this was priced right and easy to adjust to my height. I’ve been practicing using it and I’m comfortable with how it operates. I would recommend something on the back legs - tennis balls or layers of fabric - I was afraid it might scratch the hardwood floors. My hubby put tennis balls in the back legs and it glides very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Build of Walker. A must for a person that needs assistance walking
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality build purchased for elderly relative and it helps her with walking. I noticed most people put tennis balls on the legs without the wheels. Just take 2 tennis balls cut a slit in the balls and put on each legs. Makes it easier for elderly to slide the legs on all kinds of surfaces and not make it slippery at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Sports Fan

customer_reviews.title: folding walker
customer_reviews.text: this is very easy to fold and put in car, its very stable and price is right. I would recommend it to any one.
customer_reviews.author: cook

customer_reviews.title: The help you need to get around
customer_reviews.text: Very useful tool. Recent liver transplant recipient and required aid with walking in the first weeks of recuperation. This walker was perfect for household use. Easy to maneuver, lightweight and stable. I was 224 pounds when I started using it (am now down to 164) but at either weight it did the job for which it was intended. Very fairly priced and a very welcome aid (I no longer need it, BTW). Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A J Saveriano

customer_reviews.title: Nice walker
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cannot beat this Walker easy to fold well built light weight. It holds my body way at 210 after hip replacement. wheels work great don’t catch on carpet or tile. This Walker is a game changer could not stand or walk if I did not have it for first couple days. A real necessity for going to the restroom and just all-around life while healing. Don’t wait get after surgery. Be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but difficult to unlock.
customer_reviews.text: This walker is sturdy and relatively light in weight. However folding requires significant pressure on the two unlocking buttons while stabilizing the legs during the unlocking process. By using one's legs to anchor the walker while beginning the folding process, one can achieve the release of the locks and finish the folding process. My suggestion is to avoid the folding process as much as possible or have someone other than the patient accomplish the task.
customer_reviews.author: DrNaples

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the P.T. Told me the one I had was too tall for me. Ordered this one because it’s lowest setting was the right height for me. I am 5’2” tall. What really surprised me was that it actually has a little smaller foot print than the other one I already had and is much easier to get through doors and into the shower. The only issue I have had is that sometime it is a little difficult to get it it fold up. This is not a major issue yet but dose take a little more tome and effort occasionally
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing quality and super sturdy walker. It was incredibly quick to assemble and extremely easy to collapse when not needed! You will NOT be disappointed purchasing this particular walker. TIP: Make sure you buy a pair of “walker skis“ for the back legs if you have any type of carpeting - otherwise the back legs might snag or get cause the walker to get caught. The skis silently glide over carpet and are easy to attach!
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to set up, folds for storage.
customer_reviews.text: While preparing for a knee replacement, I realized that I’d need a second walker upstairs as well as on the main floor so I purchased this one since it is the same as the one from my orthopedic surgeon’s office. It’s sturdy, lightweight and folds down for bringing in the car or storing. There are a number of options for baskets and glides to put on the legs which are also available on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.

customer_reviews.title: Standard walker
customer_reviews.text: This is a standard walker that I imagine it's easy to use. I, however, needed a shorter walker for my shrinking grandmother. I ended up at a medical supply store, which was twice the price. I only give it three stars because I wasn't able to see it in action. The one that I ended up buying is the same maker and it served its purpose. Luckily my 100 year old grandmother is using a cane now.
customer_reviews.author: zEPoL

customer_reviews.title: peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: my husband is having cancer treatments and also had a bout with pneumonia that weakened him quite a bit. he didnt think he needed this so i tucked it in the closet. long story short he had an episode where if i wouldnt have had this it would have been a disaster. it is strong and reliable yet lightweight (my husband is a big guy). ez for me to fold up. i do not regret buying it even if its only needed on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and construction
customer_reviews.text: Price point very economical. A similar,but slightly inferior quality, walker at a national chain drug store was priced at over three times what this item sold for on Amazon. Also, delivery was very fast: two days (over a weekend yet) with free Prime shipping.
customer_reviews.author: tallcharlie

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this walker for my father-in-law. We chose it based on the other positive reviews, and they were right. This is the EXACT same walker my father-in-law was using in the hospital. We are impressed with the quality, ease of assembly, ability to be adjusted for height, and sturdiness - especially considering the amazingly reasonable price. At the hospital, they asked us why we bought one when we could have borrowed or rented. My answer - why do that when the price was so freakin' low? Anyway, we're very happy with this walker - we may even end up using it ourselves a few years down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle711

customer_reviews.title: Folding walker
customer_reviews.text: I just had a knee replacement and this walker is my new best friend. It has been perfect in every aspect I hoped. Rolls well over the carpet. It folds easily. It's a very nice weight also. Very glad I got itt. i
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Balmer

customer_reviews.title: As good as the expensive walkers
customer_reviews.text: My mom needed a walker after knee surgery and when I saw the price at the medical supply store I was shocked. They were lasted at around $300. I was afraid that this one was going to be cheap looking but it is exactly like the one she used in physical therapy. I tell everyone I know to check Amazon before buying a walker now. This walker is very nice and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for me!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had surgery and needed something to help me walk temporarily. I love this walker. I only had to use it for a couple of weeks for short walks and in my home and it worked perfectly. It folded easily, was light but stable and didn’t take up a lot of space when maneuvering through our doors & hallways (small 1948 home). I no longer need it but it was something I relied on daily and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: good and bad features
customer_reviews.text: It is light which I like but too light for outdoors on brick or cracked pavement. Hard to control then. Easily put into back seat of car. It is narrow so not suitable of a man or large woman. Better for indoor use and the narrowness makes it easy to maneuver and move through doors and into closets and bathrooms.
customer_reviews.author: anne's mom

customer_reviews.title: For Hip TJR Same as Hospital
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very sturdy and easy to use tooling around. Purchased in advance of Total Hip Replacement. Brought to hospital day of surgery for post op PT training, use in hospital and to return home. Hospital RN said same walker they use and better. Open box item arrived with no signs of damage. The walker was wrapped in original plastic with package strapping and brand new. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Parrillo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT very light easy to navigate around
customer_reviews.text: I thought I wouldn't be able to walk for 6 weeks and this item would have been Perfect. It's very light held up to 350 lbs. according to the description. I'm 5.1" and it's adjustable "GREAT PRODUCT" so happy I bought it also very happy only needed for 2 days and it was under $30.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Good walker but not enough info in your ad
customer_reviews.text: The ad for this walker had no mention of the height. Once we received it, it was too high, even when set to the lowest setting for my 4'11" mother, the person intended to use it. We ended up donating it to the care center where my mother had stayed during her rehab. Your ad should mention patient height information, even if it is an adjustable height walker. As far as the integrity of the walker itself, it was perfectly OK. I lowered the rating not based on the walker itself, but rather the lack of information placed in the ad for the walker through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: jlopatin

customer_reviews.title: it's a great buy. Love the adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on this, and I can see why so many people thought they were sent 2 left wheels. You really need to just take a minute and move them around into position - Then you will see that no, you were not sent lefts! Aside from this, it's a great buy. Love the adjustments, love that it folds easily. Very satisfied with it! (I purchased this for my 78 year old mom)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Witt

customer_reviews.title: Everything Drive Medical makes is made to last
customer_reviews.text: I have many Drive Medical products purchased for my wife and like the others this walker is made with safety and durability in mind. Not only are they the most affordable medical care products on the market, they are very dependable. When faced with a purchasing decision between several brands I will always choose Drive because I'm convinced they are the best value.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Well made, lightweight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have when I overdo my daily activities and cause my hip to not work properly. What a pleasant surprise! The price was low enough that I won't worry if I never use it but it's sturdy enough that I would get lots of use from it. It's lightweight, folds up easily and tucks into no space at all. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: GoofeeGirlee

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. he could zip along with no problem
customer_reviews.text: gave this to my Dad and we got it adjusted to the right height for him. put on the basket and headed out to the movies. It worked great. he could zip along with no problem. at first he said the basket wasn't necessary, but found that is was a great addition. it's light, folds up compact and easily. a worthwhile investment. the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars: it can be a little difficult to collapse. works best if it can be resting against something for resistance, otherwise it can be tough to fold up.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea A Cimbura

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: Got this to have "just in case" and sure enough ended up needing it. It works fine and is adjustable in height, used around the house. I borrowed a friend's rollator with a seat and it was nice to be able to use the seat to transport food and drink from kitchen to dining area, or have the option of taking a seat when out and about.
customer_reviews.author: BixFan

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonderful for wife after surgery
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together; after surgery wife was able to maneuver thru the house at her own pace and without worry. Very stable and wheels worked good. Only used it outside once for a doctor appointment but worked okay. After two weeks not needed but will maintain for future. I have had my left hip replaced several times and dislocated two years ago so will come in handy in case needed for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good for short term use
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonable price makes this ideal for short term use such as partial knee replacement surgery. Spring loaded catches lock for fold/unfold. Very easy to adjust to your height. Detent pins are easily set and good instructions are supplied. Light weight for use and good portability. No frills on this very basic unit. None of the following: Seat, Shelf, Cup Holder, Brake.
customer_reviews.author: Soddy Prince

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Walker
customer_reviews.text: I use a walker every so often when a bad nerve flares up in my leg. This walker is sturdy, easy to open, and easy to fold closed for storage. It glides easily across carpeted floors, but doesn't get away from you. It's very stable, and has just enough weight to make me feel secure and safe using it, but not too much to make it hard to negotiate and store away. It's solid and I expect it will last a very, very long time. I probably will never need another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hoy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a walker after open-heart surgery, and this one worked out perfectly. With a tray I ordered separately that fit on top he could use it while sitting in his recliner as a table for meals and as as desk for his laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Passionate Reader

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED in what I received
customer_reviews.text: This walker that was shipped to me is nothing remotely resembles what is shown. VERY DISAPPOINTED in what I received. I received a model that is more of a poor quality. The brand name received is SUNMARK not a Drive Medical. Cost to send back is way too much to do it. BEWARE when ordering this model. I guess the company thought I would not notice as they slipped a less inferior product to me. CROOKS
customer_reviews.author: John Z.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had plantar fascia release surgery and Achilles’ tendon repair. Used scooter then progressed to walker. Just wanted something cheap to get me thro til I could walk using boot. I’m 200 pounds and it didn’t break lol. Just add tennis balls so it can slide across floor rather than having to lift it each step. Lightweight and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nordstrom

customer_reviews.title: Nice wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: We bought this wheelchair for my mom while she needed it for rehab. It's lightweight which is nice for those of us who have to fold and lift it in/out of a vehicle. Being lightweight also makes it easy for my mom to maneuver herself around, even in tight spaces. She likes it much better than a big, heavier chair she used for a bit at the rehab facility. It appears to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burnside

customer_reviews.title: Walker for Elderly Person
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new replacement Walker for my mother, who is a elderly women. She is so happy that her Walker just arrive early then expected. She had a older Walker which she was given from her doctor of Health Hospital. She really loves her new presents. We will order another Walker in near future. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Hot$hot5

customer_reviews.title: Very nice walker for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I pre ordered this for an upcoming knee surgery I’m having. Simple tool free assembly. Seems well made. Easy to adjust to my height of 6’3”. Easy to fold and light weight. It will get a lot of use soon.
customer_reviews.author: PT-13Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Nice Walker
customer_reviews.text: I especially like the price. They are cheap enough that we solved the problem of taking these with us when traveling by air. Most carriers want to put it with checked luggage, which we were concerned about. We shipped one to each of our children's homes so that there is one there whenever we visit.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie W.

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I have to use a walker to keep from playing pinball with the walls. This has fit the bill nicely. It is a very sturdy walker. I bought the "Used Like New" . The first one to arrive was missing the legs and wheels. I just had to let them know, and the next day a replacement arrived. This one was complete. It was also "Used Like New". Assembly should take about 5 mins. Unless like me, you don't pay attention, then it takes a little longer. Overall I'm very please with my entire experience.
customer_reviews.author: Frankster

customer_reviews.title: Lighweight, ready to use.
customer_reviews.text: My father needed a lightweight walker for the home to help transfer and walk short distances. This came in very useful during his home hospice care and allowed him to help with necessary mobility. It is strictly an indoor walker.
customer_reviews.author: mamamia

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I really like the walker. It is quite stable for me. What I didn’t like is the plastic cover on the bottom of two legs. They pick up every little rock. We have hardwood floors. I have scraped them severely. I used to to have different feet on the back legs of my other walker. I’ll have to look on line for them.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Willis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but light enough to lift.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this used, but in like new condition. It said the box was damaged but it was perfect inside. I am very pleased. I have a walker for inside but I needed something to get out to my car with that I could lift and put in the car itself. I think this is goning to be just perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Trowbridge

customer_reviews.title: Just right for the the job..
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a lumbar fusion..so thought it be a good idea to get a walker..didn't want to buy a real expensive one since I wouldn't be needing it long..This walker is just right and not cheaply made at all..Legs are adjustable I'm 5'2 so needed a shorter length..Was so easy to put together..i highly recommend..
customer_reviews.author: Singh

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: My 84 year old Mom fell down a couple times in a 3 week period, so I bought this walker for her to use in the house. She has a large wheeled one for outdoors, but it is too big and heavy to use indoors. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this walker for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe Mobility
customer_reviews.text: My mother needed a second walker for the second floor of her condo. Ordered this since it was similar to the walker received when discharged from the hospital and that she was comfortable with. This walker is slightly narrower than that one and fits through doorways better. Perfect solution for safe mobility.
customer_reviews.author: indytech

customer_reviews.title: Great little walker!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great walker. I am 6'2" 270lbs, and this thing has been holding up like a champ. Its easy to assemble. Light weight. Folds and unfolds easily. This has been a life-saver for me in allowing me to get mobile again and start rehabbing my leg. I strongly recommend with walker to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Tiller

customer_reviews.title: Fine for small person, temporary use.
customer_reviews.text: This walker is pretty flimsy, especially at maximum height, where the legs are a bit wobbly. At $30, it's barely usable. I'm 6'3", 210 lbs. If you're over six feet or 180 pounds, I'd recommend a better walker. The Medline Heavy Duty at ~$60 is much, much sturdier and has a much wider range of adjustment. In this case, you actually do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: L. Larson

customer_reviews.title: No One Likes IT
customer_reviews.text: No one likes it. We had a much smoother model that was easier to open and close. We are a caregiving family and the dislike is unanimous
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Boy

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Deluxe Two Button Folding Walker with 5-Inch Wheels
product_meta.description: For a safe, convenient aid to performing daily activities, a walker can be the ideal solution. Drive's new Deluxe Folding Walker combines the strength and durability with lightweight ease of use. The walker features a unique push button mechanism for easy folding. Its U-shaped frame offers greater clearance while its enhanced cross-frame design provides you with greater stability. The Folding Aluminum Walker offers 5" wheels and newly designed rear glide caps for use on many types of terrain, while the contoured hand grip and adjustable height make the Folding Aluminum Walker comfortable to use.
feature_bullets: Comes with wheels and a vinyl contoured hand grip. With your arm extended down, handle should be at wrist height. With your hand placed on the hand grip, your elbow should be flexed 20 to 30 inch
Each side operates independently to allow easy movement through narrow spaces and greater stability while standing
Easy push button mechanisms may be operated by fingers, palms or side of hand
Newly designed rear glide cap allows for walker to slide easily and smoothly over most surfaces

Sturdy 1 inch diameter aluminum construction ensures maximum strength while remaining lightweight. Do not use on stairs or escalator. Caution be aware of electrical cords in way, liquids on floor, throw rugs, toys or debris, furniture, doors and door steps and gaps in floor

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
